bibl.title: Junichi Yamamoto v. Luther Weedin. Bail Bond
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that we, JUNICHI YAMAMOTO, as principal, and UNITED STTES FIDELITY AND GUARANTY COMPANY, a corporation organized and existing under and by virture of the laws of the State of Maryland, authorized to transact the business of surety within the State of Washington, as surety, are held and firmly bound unto the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA In the penal sum of One Hundred Dollars ($1000,00, for the payment of which we jointly and severally are held and firmly bound by these presents.
DATED at Seattle, Washington, this 9th day of March,1922.

THE CONDITION of this obligation is such that, WHEREAS the above entitled court has issued an order in the above entitled cause directing a writ of habeas corpus to issue to Luther Weedin, United StatesCommissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, and directing that the above named petition- er and the principal in this obligation be released upon furnish- ing a bond in the penal sum of One Hundred Dollars ($1000,00).

NOW THEREFORE, if the said Junichi Yamamoto will surrender himself to Luther Weedin, United States Commissioner of Immigra- tion at Seattle, Washington, in the event that the petition of the said Junichi Yamamoto is denied, or in the event that the said Luther Weedin, United StatesCommissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, by the above entitled court, then these pres- ents shall be void, otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
UNITED STATES FIDELITY AND GUARANTY CO.
